works.name: eWallet
works.desc: eWallet was my first project using Vue.js. The purpose of the project was to build a digital wallet website using Vue. The project also included using LocalStorage to store all the cards that were added, as a way of practicing sending and retrieving data.
req: Build the web page following the design that was provided
Should be a Single Page Application
Should be possible to add and remove cards
The add a card form should be validated before post
works.thoughts: eWallet was one of my favorite projects to work on. The design provided was fun to re-create in CSS and after the main design was done I was given room to add my own finishing touches allowing me to practice using CSS animations.

works.name: Instablam
works.desc: Instablam is a made-up app for taking and editing photos with a device's camera. The project had three main purposes. The first was to make a PWA and practice on using service workers. The second purpose was to learn how to implement third-party JavaScript libraries. For this project the library CamanJS was used to add the photo editing functions, like contrast controls. The last purpose was to learn how to use web APIs. Since Instablam was about taking and editing photos, the web API MediaDevices was used to access a device's camera.
req: Should be installable
Should have a fallback for offline-mode
Should be responsive
Should use MediaDevices for access to device camera
works.thoughts: This was my first PWA, and I learned a lot during this project. My biggest obstacle during the project was implementing CamanJS, as I felt the documentation was a bit lacking. However, after some googling and trial-and-error testing, I got it working with my code the way I wanted it to.

works.name: AirBean
works.desc: AirBean was a project where we, in a team of two, were to create a web application for a made-up service that delivers coffee with drones. We were provided with a design and an API to use on our site.
req: Build the web page following the design that was provided
Should be a Single Page Aplication using vue-router
Should use Vuex and a Vuex store
works.thoughts: This was a very good project for practicing teamwork. We worked in an organised way, starting of with creating a plan and project guide for what should be done and when it should be finished. During the project we communicated a lot, reporting our progress, what our next plan was and if we needed help. Thanks to our communication the project went very smoothly, and without stress.

works.name: Awesome Gallery
works.desc: Awesome Gallery is a simple image search website. The purpose of the project was to create a website using the flickr API in order to practice implementation of third-party APIs.
req: Should use the Flickr API
Code should be divided in ES6 modules
The webpage should be responsive
works.thoughts: Awesome Gallery was my first larger JavaScript project, as well as the first project in which I got to use a third-party API. Before this project I had had a hard time understanding JavaScript promises and how they work, but as I worked with Awesome Gallery I finally felt like I understood how to use them.

works.name: TOGEI Japanese ceramics
works.desc: TOGEI Japanese ceramics was a full stack project where I had to create both the front end and the basic back end for an e-commerce site. The purpose of this project was to learn about how the back end and front end communicate with each other, and to gain a deeper understanding of API implementation.
works.thoughts: This was a very interesting project, that greatly helped me understand how the back end and front end comes together.
req: Build a basic API in NodeJs
Create a database in LowDB
Create a webpage that utilises the API
JavaScript should be divided into modules
Should implement all functionality requirements that were provided

works.name: Music Player
works.desc: Music Player was a small side project challenge with the purpose of practicing JavaScript programming. The challenge was to create a simple music player from scratch using JavaScript in less than 3 hours.
works.thoughts: This was a very fun side project that tested not only my JavaScript skills, but also my ability to make quick decisions. I had to make decisions both regarding the design of the player, as well as code architecture and functions.
req: Create a working music player within 3 hours

works.name: Where Its@
works.desc: Where Its@ was a small group project where we were to create an event ticket app. The purpose of the project was to practice working in a full stack team. The group was divided into one back end and two front end teams. The front end teams had their own responsibilities; one team was responsible for the user pages the other for the admin/staff pages.
works.thoughts: In this project I was part of the front end team responsible for the user pages. It was a very fun and meaningful project, where you really got to see how important good communication is in larger groups where teams have differing responsibilities.
req: Group should be divided into three teams; one back end and two front end
